song.title: Lumper's Life
song.chorus: And it's all the night and half a day Sweating for your lumpers pay Fill the boxes up and down, lumping's hard in grimsby Town
song.verse: The fish are waiting in the hole And nights have come to town Folks with sense are in their beds but the lumpers they go down Down pneumonia jetty where the wind cuts like a knife I wish to christ I never started on the lumping life

We're called the midnight millionaires by folks who'll never know How your hands go stiff incased in ice when the temperatures below The wind cuts through your guts me lads your face is stiff and blue And you wish the trawler rollers were down there instead of you

Me father was a lumper and a dockman all his life Me mother told me sister never be a lumper's wife You'll wash his fishy overalls and darn his stiff old socks And every night you'll sleep alone while he goes down the docks

If ever I win the pools me lads me lumping days are through I'll cash me check from little woods and I know just what I'll do I'll treat me mates and say goodbye and leave the lumping life And then I'll go to bed at night and get to know me wife

I'll burn me dirty clogs and throw me lumping card away I'll put me leggings in the shed and leave them there to stay I'll tell the lousy setter on to stop his midnight call And turn me back forever on the bloody cold north wall
